Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now, I see that there are three distinct patient demographics: - Patient A: age 45, gender M, initially in ER - Patient B: age 62, gender F, initially in ER - Patient C: age 28, gender M, initially in Surgery

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The departments might change, but the patient age and gender should be consistent within a case. Also, the activities should make sense for a patients journey.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Let me try to group events for each patient. Start with Patient A: age 45, gender M - Event 1: Register patient in ER - Event 4: Initial triage in ER - Event 7: X-ray imaging in Radiology (likely for ER patient) - Event 12: Doctor consultation in ER (diagnosis: hairline fracture) - Event 15: Patient discharged from ER That seems like a complete journey for an ER patient with a fracture.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now Patient B: age 62, gender F - Event 2: Register patient in ER - Event 5: Initial triage in ER - Event 8: Lab test requested in ER - Event 10: Lab test completed in Laboratory - Event 11: Doctor consultation in ER (diagnosis: minor infection) - Event 14: Prescription created in ER - Event 17: Patient discharged from ER This also seems complete.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now Patient C: age 28, gender M - Event 3: Register patient in Surgery (unusual, but possible for scheduled surgery) - Event 6: Doctor consultation in Surgery (reason: scheduled knee surgery) - Event 9: Surgery preparation in Surgery - Event 13: Surgery performed in Surgery - Event 16: Recovery room in Surgery - Event 18: Patient discharged from Surgery This seems like a scheduled surgery patient.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I notice that all events are accounted for. Also, the timestamps seem consistent within each case. For example, for Patient A, events are at 08:05, 08:10, 08:15, 08:23, 08:30, which makes sense sequence-wise. Similarly for others.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I should confirm if any event is missing or if theres overlap. Event 12 is for age 45, which I have in Case 1, and Event 11 is for age 62, in Case 2. Event 6,9,13,16,18 are for age 28, in Case 3. Also, note that Event 10 is Lab test completed for age 62, which follows Event 8 Lab test requested, so it should be in Case 2. Similarly, Event 7 X-ray for age 45 should be after initial triage and before doctor consultation, which matches.
